fields.description:
Does JIRA allow an application to pass an API which will automatically create an issue?

For example:  If a web application throws a java exception, is there an API that I can pass this exception into JIRA and create the issue automatically for a particular Project? 

Thanks.
fields.summary: QUESTION:  API

fields.description:
We are having an issue with JIRA - after we restarted our JIRA server, we are able to file new issues, but they do not show up in our issue browser. They are in the database, and they do show up when we link directly to them. 
Please help.
fields.summary: New Issues do not show up in folders after reboot

fields.description:
Is there a way to provide a CVS API into JIRA so that code can be checked in and out of CVS via JIRA?  Can you send me info on how the "CVS Modules" administration works when administering a Project?

Thanks.
fields.summary: QUESTION:  CVS Repository

fields.description:
If I delete a file attachment from an issue.  Then click on a link to view another attachment for the same issue, clicking "Back" on the browser to go back to ManageAttachments.jspa gives me the following error:

ERRORS: 
An error occurred removing attachment: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: GenericValue cannot be null. 

This is not a big deal since the error occurs because clicking "Back" actually goes back to deleting the previous attachment.  And since that attachment is no longer there, it's throwing an exception.  So a error handling issue.
fields.summary: Error in managing file attachment

I appear to have some sort of event listener problem.

I upgraded from 2.6.1 to 3.0.3 and the war build and db upgrade seemed to work just fine.

Attached is the jboss debug trace of the deploy attempt.

I have also granted the security policy to grant allPermission and it has no effect.
fields.summary: Can't deploy jira war after upgrade to 3.0.3 from 2.6.1 professional

fields.description:
Our Jira installation suddenly died, structure was fine but all issues were gone.

After several attemps rebooting the server, the Attachment/indexes/backups folders wehre backedup and a system restore was made.

Restore went well and  all issues were restored properly. The problem is that attachment links are broken (404) even tough those attachments are in the folder. Tested uploading an attachment and went without problems, was placed properly next to the others for that issue. The issue has the links for the old attachments and the new attachment, only can open the new attachment the others get 404. URL looks well build compared to the tested attachment that works.

Any suggestions?
Thanks!
fields.summary: After restore links to attchments are broken

</webwork:if>

fields.description:
When JIRA sends emails, the from line in the email is set to:
   From: "Jonathan Payne (JIRA)" <jira@myserver.com>
(where the name changes based on the user that caused the change)

Most email programs display the nice text version of the 'From' part.  Unfortunately, some of our beta testers get a little confused by this and reply to the automatic emails JIRA sends out.  This is unfortunate as I then have do work out who to pass their email on to.

I think it would be better if emails used were formatted as:
   From: "JIRA (Jonathan Payne)" <jira@myserver.com>

So it is clear that they came from a JIRA server and the user name is just an extra bit of information.  This would also have the nice benefit of making JIRA emails sort together.
fields.summary: Make email 'from' line configurable

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1035

fields.description:
Previous summary:

Bulk change of "Perforce Job" field does not trigger perforce job creations

If I use Jira's bulk edit facility to change a set of issues to have the "Perforce Job" field set to true, the bulk edit works, but no corresponding jobs are actually created in perforce.

This is actually due to the fact that JIRA does not fire the relevant event on updating the custom field. Moved to JIRA and updated summary accordingly.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit of Custom Field does not fire any event.
Not all frequently used links have accesskeys

fields.description: In the 'log work' page, it should be possible to enter the 'time spent' field, press tab 5 times to get to 'Work Description', and then submit the form.  However when tabbing onto the 'Adjust Estimate' text field, the 'Set estimated time remaining' radio button is automatically selected when focus enters the text field.
fields.summary: Can't tab through 'log work' page without changing things

fields.description: Many users are shooting themselves in the foot with the 'Update Issue Field' post-function.  For instance, they might try to update the 'Resolution' field value to 'Duplicate'.  This then breaks JIRA, as the 'resolution' field value *actually* has to be a foreign key ID into the resolution table.
fields.summary: 'Update Issue Field' post-function value not checked for validity

fields.description:
Java apps like JIRA emit stacktraces when things go wrong.  Inside a stacktrace, the most important 'signature' part is the classname:linenumber part, eg. ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:94 in the stacktrace:

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.initialise(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:94)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyLauncher.contextInitialized(ConsistencyLauncher.java:27)

Unfortunately, searching for 'ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:94' in JIRA does not return any hits (on jira.atlassian.com, this is in a comment on JRA-5371).
fields.summary: Searching doesn't return anything for foo:bar searches

fields.description:
Intermittently but often, when an issue has a fixed for version and you edit the issue, the fix for version drop down will not be present. Instead, the Fix For version will indicate Unknown even though there is a version. Then when you update some other field or simply update without changing any thing the Fix For version is blanked.

Thus far, I have been unable to define the steps to reliable replicate this issue. It is quite serious though since it causes issues to drop off release communications and potentially we release code that has not been tested.
fields.summary: Loss of data when performing an edit

fields.description:
I have created a filter that selects issues with due date before a specific date. I have then placed a Two Dimensional Filter Statistics based on this filter, as suggested in your documentation, in the Default Dashboard. The resulting table provides the correct data, but all the links have due date in the wrong format.

This results in the filter not being applied when clicking on a link in the table, and an error message being shown. The links have due date represented as "2004-12-01+00:00:00.0", while the IssueNavigator (that is linked to) expects a format like "01-Dec-2004".
fields.summary: Links with Date in Filter Statistics use incorrect date format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5386].
  {panel}

When you have just created a workflow, the subsequent steps required to 'enable' it are:

 - Create a workflow scheme
 - Add workflow to scheme
 - Associate scheme with project

This is not at all obvious from the web interface.
fields.summary: Activating workflows in JIRA Enterprise is unintuitive

fields.description: In 3.0.3, JIRA now displays an up-arrow for the default oldest-to-newest comment sort order.  This seems backwards - it should be a down-arrow.
fields.summary: Comment sort order icon backwards

fields.description: It would be great if it were possible to have each filter have its own navigator configuration for its results. Having only one navigator configuration for all search results returns is too restrictive.
fields.summary: Allow different Navigator configurations per filter

fields.description:
I'd love to be able to access the results of My Votes and My Watches as a filter. This would allow me to access this data via existing filter functionality. Most of the benefits of this would be related to the dashboard.

Some example uses could be:

- Inclusion of My Votes/Watches on dashboard
    - Filter statistics reporting
    - Two dimensional filter statistics
- Sharing of vote/watch data

I find these features very useful with normal filters and I guess it just seems a little counter intuitive NOT to have access to the vote/watch data in this way.
fields.summary: My Votes and My Watches as filters

fields.description: Is it possible to add a "bulk close" feature to jira? I use jira for system logs, and sometimes I get a lot of issues (eg: rebuilding of a raid, where the mails only contain info about status of the rebuild process), and in such cases it would be nice to be able to bulk-close all those issues (more that 100) instead of closing each one individually
fields.summary: bulk close
Title of subtask in roadmap and in reports has only parent ID
Allow sub-taks to be in a different project

fields.description:
When an issue is deleted, associated OS_CURRENTSTEP and OS_HISTORYSTEP records are not deleted.  This can be shown with the query:

select OS_CURRENTSTEP.ID
    from OS_CURRENTSTEP left join jiraissue
    on OS_CURRENTSTEP.ENTRY_ID=jiraissue.WORKFLOW_ID
  where jiraissue.WORKFLOW_ID is null;

And {{_PREV}} step tables.
fields.summary: Deleting an issue does not remove its OS_CURRENTSTEP records

fields.description:
JRA-5085 although 'closed' seems to still exist in 3.03

I've attached a modified 3.02 file 'view_subtaskissues.jsp' with slight tweaks to fix the assignee width dropbox problem, and the sub-task wrapping problem.

tested IE6 pc.

cheers,

James
fields.summary: Rendering Bug in Sub-Tasks table - followup

fields.description:
we have problems updagrading to 3.0.3 prof.(also tested with enterprise)
all upgrades until 3.0.3 are working. we tried to updgrade to 3.0.3 on a existing database and an empty database. always the same problem on startup
with the consistency check, i think.
also tested xml backup on a standalone jira - data of our production system was successfully imported  to standalone jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5370].
  {panel}

We are using an external tool to develop JIRA reports.
This tool connects directly to the database to generate reports.
It works fine except for reports that are using rules based on the history of changes.
In fact, the way you are storing changes in the changeitem table is not suitable and not generic enough.
You are storing only strings.

2 examples :

- Regarding the way you are qtoring dates: you are storing them using the screen format. If this format changes during the life of JIRA, we will have several date formats in the history. Then, it's very difficul for our reporting tool to analyse the dates and make differences...
- Regarding the custom fields:
   - you are storing the values as string.
   - You are storing only the name of the custom fields and not their ID. So, if the name changes, the external reporting tool will be unable to get the history of this field.

So, you should change the way you are storing changes by :
- storing old values and new values like the CUSTOMFIELDVALUE does
- storing the ID of custom fields and not only the name.

Today, we can answer to the need of users that want to have complex reports, but we know that if some custom field names change, the reports won't work anymore...

Do you think you could change this in a future version ?
fields.summary: Changes are not stored in a proper way

fields.description:
We have several Field Layout Schemes for our project, each matching a different Issue Type. When I hide a version field ("Affects Version/s", "Fix Version/s") in ONE of our Field Layout Schemes, Roadmap and/or Change Log disapear from the Browse Project page. Also, the Find Issues page no longer shows the "Fix For:" and/or "Matches Versions:" criteria (when selecting our specific project).

I would be glad to hide these features when ALL of my Field Layout Schemes hide the version fields. However, what I expected to see was that, when only SOME of the Field Layout Schemes did hide the version fields, then these features would still be available but they would not show (or match on) the issues of types which were associated to a Field Layout Scheme hiding the version fields.

I guess from issue JRA-5304 that the same situation happens with the Component/s field.

The problem is that these fields make sense for almost all of my issue types (therefore Field Layout Shemes) but are not relevant for very specific issue types (specific kinds of Tasks and Sub-Tasks).
fields.summary: Roadmap & Change Log disapear when ONE Field Layout hides version fields

fields.description:
As the number of available issue-operations keeps increasing, keeping the interface simple is a great challenge. Actually the order of operations is not very user-friendly, as many commonly used operations tend to be right in the middle, and the least-used operations are found right at the beginning.

I would propose changing the order of operations.

Here is the order, i would suggest:

- Edit issue
- Comment Issue
- Attach File
- Screenshot
- Assign (to me)
- Link Issue
- Create Sub-Task (Please set the link on the word "Sub-Task" instead of "Create", then its quicker to find for the common user)
- Vote Issue
- Watch Issue
- Log Work
- Clone Issue
- Move Issue
fields.summary: Create more ergonomic order of Operations

See screenshot attached ("ARS" is the read-only custom field).

The need to rename the options in a custon field. The only options I can find are to delete the old one and add a new option. The problem with this is If I add a new option the custom field, I would need to migrate all issues from the old option to the new one. I cannot find a way to do this, other than adding the new option, then moving the values manually for each issue, then deleting the old value.

Is there a better way?
fields.summary: Rename options in a custom field

fields.description:
We have several bugzilla instances we want to migrate to one JIRA installation. It took me some time to find out but during import there is a map created from bugzilla profile (==user) ids to Jira user ids. For a new import this mapping is reused, meaning that if you import a second bugzilla you will get the mapping from the first import and so the wrong JIRA users are assigned to the issues.

It would be more safe to empty the map on each import.
fields.summary: Second  bugzilla import  uses usermappings from the first

fields.description:
After upgrading to Jira 3.0.3 Professional, I was unable to filter issues because I could not use options "Any time" in fields "Updated in previous" (and also "Created in previous") and the result is that the system tries to filter issues Created in previous hour (Day, Month respectively)

The same for fields "Issue type", "Reported By", "Assignee", etc.

Steps to reproduce it:
1. Browse project
2. Choose "All" below the "Preset filters" group
3. click Edit filter
4. check the option lists, or just press View&Hide
5. => new conditions were added to filter...

Was there any new setting added for this behaviour into the v3.0.3?
Thank you
fields.summary: Can not choose "Any user" or "Any time" options  when editing filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5335].
  {panel}

So what would be cool for large installations would be a vacation plugin.  A user, say Alice, tells Jira that she'll be gone from Date X to Date Y.  Jira then presents Alice with a list of all the Projects and Components and other pre-set assignments that she is configured for.  Alice can then individually or in batch (checkboxes or whatever) select another Jira user or users to have newly created issues assigned to them while she's away.  In fact, the email template for vacation issue creation may even be different.  E.g.  JiraBob, you've been assigned this issue (yadahdhdhdha) b/c Alice is away on vacation from X to Y.  (if the current date is close enough to y, JiraBob may choose to ignore it :)

What do you think?  Or is this functionality there already in a way that I'm not aware of?  This would really help us in that issues wouldn't a. fall thru cracks and b. when getting back from vacation (yes, sometimes we take vacation) we don't have a pile of issues waiting for us.

I'm willing to start and tackle this as a plugin.  I don't have a source/commercial license.  Can I build this plugin without the source, just using the API and Jira blogs/email lists?  I don't want to go down the road if I'm not goign to be able to finish it.

(i) This plugin can be used [Out Of Office Assistant|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.akelesconsulting.jira.plugins.OutOfOfficeAssistant/server/overview], Please contact the plugin vendor in order to make sure about functionality as Atlassian does not support third party plugins.
fields.summary: Vacation Plugin!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5326].
  {panel}

In the project admin page, we should clean up the visual representation of the default assignee.  We don't show anywhere the per-component default assignees.  This leaves the user seeing "Default Assignee: Project Lead", which is not true if a per-component assignee is set. When users edit the project to change "Project Lead" to something else, there is again no mention of per-component assignees.

Perhaps we could have a separate section for default assignees:

Default assignee [edit]:
----------------
    Default: Project Lead
    Component A: fred
    Component B: joe
    Component C: Component Lead

 ~ Unassigned issues (are|are not) allowed

(here also consolidating the 'allow unassigned issues' option, currently lost in General Configuration)

Later, if we decide to allow rules to be specified to choose the default assignee on a case-by-case basis, they can go in this section too.

fields.description:
When doing a bulk edit on a custom field a re-index is required for filtering to work properly.

To duplicate:
1. Set up a filter on some custom field that will match some issues.
2. Bulk edit those issues such that the filter should show nothing.
3. Return to the filter.

Expected behavior:
  No issues shown.

Actual behavoir:
  The issues will still be shown and if the custom field is displayed in the issue list it will show the new value.  Then do a re-index of the issues and return to the filter.  Now nothing will be displayed.
fields.summary: Bulk edit of Custom Field requires re-indexing for filtering

fields.description:
Our JIRA users have somehow entered 0x1c-characters (file separator) to description-field on a couple of issues. When the database is exported to XML and imported back, the import fails due to the 0x1c character in a CDATA block. It can't even be fixed by changing the description using JIRA, as the invalid character is also in the change history. We had to remove these by hand from the database.

Marked this issue critical as it also breaks upgrading from 3.0.1 to 3.0.3 which relies on export/import.
fields.summary: XML import fails due to invalid characters

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1. Import one bugzilla project (A), do not check "Import only new issues".
2. Import one bugzilla project (A), check "Import only new issues".
3. Import a different bugzilla project (B), do not check "Import only new issues".
4. Import a different bugzilla project (B), check "Import only new issues".

After step 1, project A has been imported once. (check!)
After step 2, project A has been imported once. (check!)
After step 3, project B has been imported once, (check!)
          and project A has been imported twice. (noooo!)
After step 4, project B has been imported once, (check!)
          and project A has been imported twice. (check! ... sort of)

So, importing only new issues works fine, but project selection does not.  From the looks of the source, Map projectToBugzillaIdMap is initialized on line 96 once when JIRA loads.  It is used create the sql statement for issue selection (whereSelectedProjectClause()) instead of using this.selectedProjects.  Since projectToBugzillaIdMap is only initialized when BugzillaImportBean is loaded, it accumulates every project that has been selected for import.  When an import is run, the logs claim that this.selectedProjects are being imported (correct), but proceeds to import every issue in a project in projectToBugzillaIdMap.

Fix:
Initialize projectToBugzillaIdMap on every import.  (In create() maybe?)
fields.summary: Bugzilla and Mantis import accidentally imports multiple projects

fields.description:
(Originally filed as JSP-526 on support.atlassian.com)

We are customizing our Default Dashboard for the non-techie users. We have a filter (similar to support.atlassian.com's "My Open Issues" - we called it "My Issues") we want to display on the default dashboard. We have customized the sort order and column display of the filter.

When the user logs in, it displays the filter result with the hard-coded - not our customized - columns. When the user clicks on the hyperlinked "My Issues" filter name, they enter the issue navigator and see the customized columns and sort order.

Our "My Issues" filter is desgined to display all issues reported by the current user. It displays the following columns in the issue navigator:
Updated Timestamp
Key
Summary
Status
Resolution

But when the "My Issues" filter is displayed on the dashboard it displays:
Type
Key
Summary
Priority

We would like the dashboard to display the customized columns and sort order from the issue navigator.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Filter Display on Default Dashboard not showing correct columns

fields.description:
We have a Custom Field containing a list of customers. In addition to each customer name, we had the option "<All>" (without the quotes). This worked fine in our old version of JIRA (2.5) but not in 3.0. Instead of seeing "<All>", we get a blank line. However, the blank line appears to work in that we can do a filter and choose the blank option and get a number of issues selected.

I have attached a screenshot of this issue.

I assume the workaround would be:

(1) Add a new option which can be displayed (like "ALL")

(2) Use the filter to select all issues which have "<All>" (the blank)

(3) Use the new bulk edit feature to change all "<All>" to "ALL"

(4) Remove the "<All>" from the list of options

--
Geoff Wass
Montreal, Quebec, Canada
fields.summary: A Custom field dropDownList contains a blank entry

fields.description: I am convinced that this is a duplicate of another JIRA bug, but I can't seem to find the other one.  I needed to import work history from Bugzilla, so I patched BugzillaImportBean.java.  This is a simple patch, and does not retrieve the comment associated with the work, only the hours worked and the timestamp.  If you view the All tab, the work log entry should occur just below the comment.  This patch also sets the time estimate and time remaining - hopefully correctly. :-)
